This prototype allows you to select any country or industry and then click on an asset to add it to your cart and see the total emissions of any grouping you can create! https://t.co/w12p9FZMzX

At 1230 EST, going to set an hour timer and see if I can get all of these prototype tasks done and get a shareable URL that people can play with and wrap up today's prototyping https://t.co/YIx3eNfmmX

Taking a little break, when I get back, doing more prototyping of this asset shopping cart / calculator concept where you can gather assets and see their total emissions https://t.co/bMGX3OoZfk

"The people highest up got the lowest self-esteem. The prettiest people do the ugliest things."

That time computer geeks made themselves rich by sheer force of will and a hint of cutting edge tech and chutzpah
That one time that BitCoins taught my generation of cynical techies that sometimes bandwagons are worth jumping on (to the tune of millions)
I lived in Phoenix for a while. Then I came back to NY and was like "Eh, Phoenix." Later, Oakland for a while. I think of Oakland every day.

Yeahhhh!!!! A breakthrough in this project!!! It's so exciting for me but no one cares!!!!
RT @MichaelSkolnik: I hate that Occupy protests have been degraded into standoffs w police.  Police did not bankrupt our country.  #Inte ...
Went outside for a while to record the wind for sampling... met a deer.
Tums were a very important missing part of my life.
I'm sleepin on the tramp... ...oline.
Home, House.
I'm fucking tired of these people. I need new friends.
Gonna grab a bite to eat and take a bath.
Watching some South Park, good stuff. I'm hungry. I think I'll chill for a bit and maybe sleep for an hour or so before school.
Got done with my first draft of my What's In Your Bag infographic- http://www.flickr.com/photos/pseudoplacebo/2070736882/
I love it when Uncyclopedia results come up while I'm doing my homework. http://tinyurl.com/34o9o5
Made myself a mojito- doing my Social Studies home work (english essay later), and thinking of how I can make an infographic with my stats.
Read the New York Times about evolution and art. Got me out of my malaise, temporarily. Hillary Clinton on NPR changed my idea of her.
Took a delightful little nap, and I'll do some homework in a bit. Getting really tired of doing the same thing every day. Yuck.
